item.title: penny add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "We're all made of stories. When they finally put us underground, the stories are what will go on. Not forever, perhaps, but for a time. It's a kind of immortality, I suppose, bounded by limits, it's true, but then so's everything." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: penny add a quote by charles de lint
item.description: "Every time you do a good deed you shine the light a little farther into the dark. And the thing is, when you're gone that light is going to keep shining on, pushing the shadows back." -- charles de lint

item.title: penny add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "There is only one way to read, which is to browse in libraries and bookshops, picking up books that attract you, reading only those, dropping them when they bore you, skipping the parts that drag-and never, never reading anything because you feel you ought, or because it is part of a trend or a movement. Remember that the book which bores you when you are twenty or thirty will open doors for you when you are forty or fifty-and vise versa. Don’t read a book out of its right time for you. " -- Doris Lessing

item.title: penny add a quote by Leah Cypess
item.description: "Not all dangers are obvious." -- Leah Cypess

item.title: penny add a quote by Kevin Hearne
item.description: "Yes and I appreciate it. But this is going to be difficult enough without running my words through a filter of illiteracy." -- Kevin Hearne

item.title: penny add a quote by Kevin Hearne
item.description: "Whoa. He had ghouls on speed dial. My lawyer kicks so much ass." -- Kevin Hearne

item.title: penny add a quote by Kevin Hearne
item.description: "Dude. If that was a Shakespearean quote duel, he just kicked your ass." -- Kevin Hearne

item.title: penny add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: penny add a quote by Anne McCaffrey
item.description: "The tears I feel today I'll wait to shed tomorrow. Though I'll not sleep this night Nor find surcease from sorrow. My eyes must keep their sight: I dare not be tear-blinded. I must be free to talk Not choked with grief, clear-minded. My mouth cannot betray The anguish that I know. Yes, I'll keep my tears til later: But my grief will never go." -- Anne McCaffrey

item.title: penny add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: penny add a quote by Elizabeth Zimmerman
item.description: "Properly practiced, knitting soothes the troubled spirit, and it doesn't hurt the untroubled spirit either." -- Elizabeth Zimmerman

item.title: penny add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "There must be more to life than having everything!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: penny add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "I cry a lot because I miss people. They die and I can't stop them. They leave me and I love them more." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: penny add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: penny add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: penny add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "It isn't wise to be rude to one's mother. She knows everything about your childhood that is potentially embarassing." -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: penny add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "This I think I have learned: where there is love, the form does not matter, and the gods are pleased. This I have observed: what occurs in nature, comes by the hand of nature, and if the gods did not approve, it would not be there ~ Moondance k'Treva (Magic's Pawn)" -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: penny add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "It's only gossip if you repeat it. Until then, it's gathering information." -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: penny add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "Inexperience can be overcome, ignorance can be enlightened, but prejudice will destroy you." -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: penny add a quote by Terry Brooks
item.description: "If you do not hear music in your words, you have put too much thought into your writing and not enough heart." -- Terry Brooks

item.title: penny add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "This must be Thursday,' said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer. 'I never could get the hang of Thursdays." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: penny add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: penny add a quote by Rachel Carson
item.description: "Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts. There is something infinitely healing in the repeated refrains of nature -- the assurance that dawn comes after night, and spring after winter." -- Rachel Carson

item.title: penny add a quote by voltaire
item.description: "Le mieux est l'ennemi du bien. (The perfect is the enemy of the good.)" -- voltaire

item.title: penny add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Grown-ups don't look like grown-ups on the inside either. Outside, they're big and thoughtless and they always know what they're doing. Inside, they look just like they always have. Like they did when they were your age. Truth is, there aren't any grown-ups. Not one, in the whole wide world." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: penny add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I went away in my head, into a book. That was where I went whenever real life was too hard or too inflexible." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: penny add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Spend your money on the things money can buy. Spend your time on the things money can’t buy." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: penny add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "For both of us, it had simply been too enormous an experience. We shared it by <i>not talking about it</i>. Does this make any sense?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: penny add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Holding this soft, small living creature in my lap this way, though, and seeing how it slept with complete trust in me, I felt a warm rush in my chest. I put my hand on the cat's chest and felt his heart beating. The pulse was faint and fast, but his heart, like mine, was ticking off the time allotted to his small body with all the restless earnestness of my own." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: penny add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "What we see before us is just one tiny part of the world. We get in the habit of thinking, this is the world, but that's not true at all. The real world is a much darker and deeper place than this, and much of it is occupied by jellyfish and things." -- Haruki Murakami
